item.title: OceanaGold Loses Payment Fight Against El Salvador (OGC.TO, OGC.AX)
item.description: [at Investopedia] - An international arbitration panel in Washington on Friday ruled against OceanaGold's $284 million claim against El Salvador.

item.title: El Salvador wins case against OceanaGold
item.description: [Other] - El Salvador has came out on top in its long-running arbitration dispute with OceanaGold Corporation, a Canadian-Australian gold and copper mining company that had been seeking $US250 million ($A328 million) in compensation for a permit rejection, the World Bank's arbitration body says. Salvadoran Attorney-General Douglas Melendez announced the International Centre for Settlement of Investment Disputes' unanimous ruling at a press conference in the US, a decision that brings an end to a seven-and-a-half-year legal battle. OceanaGold also said on its website that the ICSID had ruled in favour of El Salvador and ordered the company to pay the country's government $US8 million to cover its legal fees and costs.
